Attn: Wildlife Dept
3555 Las Vegas Blvd S.
Las Vegas, NV 89109

citations.desc: Cleaning, sanitization, housekeeping, and pest control.
citations.narrative:
The outdoor pool supply and storage yard was in need of general cleaning and housekeeping. There was an
accumulation of leaf litter, items of trash, and old boxes on the ground in several areas. Along a back wall in the yard were
a few open bags of pool filter media which had spilled out on the ground below. Additionally, there was an overgrown
bush and several overgrown weeds throughout the yard. Although the facility has a plastic mesh fence installed to keep
ducks from accessing the yard, there were at least two openings large enough for ducks to pass through. According to
animal caretakers, ducks have been found on two separate occasions in this yard during the past two months. Unkept
premises where housing facilities are located may cause injury to the animals or may contribute to the harborage of
rodents and pests which may spread disease. Premises where housing facilities are located, including buildings,
surrounding grounds, and exhibit areas must be kept clean and in good repair in order to protect the birds from injury and
disease, to facilitate the husbandry practices required in this subpart, and to reduce or eliminate breeding and living areas
for rodents, pests, and vermin.
Correct by 05/14/2024.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
n

narrative:
3.158(c) 
   
Cleaning, sanitization, housekeeping, and pest control. 
The outdoor pool supply and storage yard was in need of general cleaning and housekeeping. There was an 
accumulation of leaf litter, items of trash, and old boxes on the ground in several areas. Along a back wall in the yard were 
a few open bags of pool filter media which had spilled out on the ground below. Additionally, there was an overgrown 
bush and several overgrown weeds throughout the yard. Although the facility has a plastic mesh fence installed to keep 
ducks from accessing the yard, there were at least two openings large enough for ducks to pass through. According to 
animal caretakers, ducks have been found on two separate occasions in this yard during the past two months. Unkept 
premises where housing facilities are located may cause injury to the animals or may contribute to the harborage of 
rodents and pests which may spread disease. Premises where housing facilities are located, including buildings, 
surrounding grounds, and exhibit areas must be kept clean and in good repair in order to protect the birds from injury and 
disease, to facilitate the husbandry practices required in this subpart, and to reduce or eliminate breeding and living areas 
for rodents, pests, and vermin.  
 
Correct by 05/14/2024. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative. 
 
 n
